#summary Definition of Nathan's Dull Blade Philosophy

== Overview ==

Nathan's dull blade theorem postulates that an unnecessarily complex and confusing solution is often unnecessarily complex and confusing, but much more interesting to Nathan. It is the antithesis to [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Occam's_razor Occam's Razor]. It is also the default, often randomly generated hypothesis proposed by Nathan to often simple questions/problems with well established solutions.
